item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge. That myth is more potent than history. That dreams are more powerful than facts. That hope always triumphs over experience. That laughter is the only cure for grief. And I believe that love is stronger than death." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "I like not only to be loved, but also to be told that I am loved. I am not sure that you are of the same mind. But the realm of silence is large enough beyond the grave. This is the world of light and speech, and I shall take leave to tell you that you are very dear." -- George Eliot

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Erich Fromm
item.description: "Love is a decision, it is a judgment, it is a promise. If love were only a feeling, there would be no basis for the promise to love each other forever. A feeling comes and it may go. How can I judge that it will stay forever, when my act does not involve judgment and decision." -- Erich Fromm

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Mother Theresa
item.description: "It's not how much we give but how much love we put into giving." -- Mother Theresa

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Geoff Johns
item.description: "I may not be smart enough to do everything, but I am dumb enough to try anything." -- Geoff Johns

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Helen Steiner Rice
item.description:
"When you are in troubled and worried and sick at heart And your plans are upset and your world falls apart, Remember God's ready and waiting to share
The burden you find much to heavy to bear--
So with faith, "Let Go and Let GOD" lead your way
Into a brighter and less troubled day" -- Helen Steiner Rice

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I am trying here to prevent anyone saying the really foolish thing that people often say about Him: I’m ready to accept Jesus as a great moral teacher, but I don’t accept his claim to be God. That is the one thing we must not say. A man who was merely a man and said the sort of things Jesus said would not be a great moral teacher. He would either be a lunatic — on the level with the man who says he is a poached egg — or else he would be the Devil of Hell. You must make your choice. Either this man was, and is, the Son of God, or else a madman or something worse. You can shut him up for a fool, you can spit at him and kill him as a demon or you can fall at his feet and call him Lord and God, but let us not come with any patronizing nonsense about his being a great human teacher. He has not left that open to us. He did not intend to." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "If a man is called to be a street sweeper, he should sweep streets even as a Michaelangelo painted, or Beethoven composed music or Shakespeare wrote poetry. He should sweep streets so well that all the hosts of heaven and earth will pause to say, 'Here lived a great street sweeper who did his job well." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Plato
item.description: "The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men." -- Plato

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back." -- Abigail Van Buren

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by A.J. RUSSELL
item.description: "All sacrifice and suffering is redemptive. It is used to either teach the individual or to help others. Nothing is by chance." -- A.J. RUSSELL

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Let mental culture go on advancing, let the natural sciences progress in even greater extent and depth, and the human mind widen itself as much as it desires: beyond the elevation and moral culture of Christianity, as it shines forth in the Gospels, it will not go." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Kites rise highest against the wind, not with it." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Joni Eareckson Tada
item.description: "Sometimes God allows what he hates to accomplish what he loves." -- Joni Eareckson Tada

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "God will not look you over for medals, degrees or diplomas but for scars." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "The only things one can admire at length are those one admires without knowing why." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Death is no more than passing from one room into another. But there's a difference for me, you know. Because in that other room I shall be able to see." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Savage Garden
item.description: "I knew I loved you before I met you I think I dreamed you into life I knew I loved you before I met you I have been waiting all my life" -- Savage Garden

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Zsa Zsa Gabor
item.description: "A man in love is incomplete until he has married. Then he's finished." -- Zsa Zsa Gabor

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Zsa Zsa Gabor
item.description: "Getting divorced just because you don't love a man is almost as silly as getting married just because you do. " -- Zsa Zsa Gabor

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Catherine Deneuve
item.description: "A woman has to be intelligent, have charm, a sense of humor, and be kind. It's the same qualities I require from a man." -- Catherine Deneuve

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Catherine Deneuve
item.description: "I live very normally, I go out with my friends, we go to the movies, I queue, we go to restaurants." -- Catherine Deneuve

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Matthew Henry
item.description: "Extraordinary afflictions are not always the punishment of extraordinary sins, but sometimes the trial of extraordinary graces." -- Matthew Henry

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Tommy Lasorda
item.description: "The difference between the impossible and the possible lies in a person's determination." -- Tommy Lasorda

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The rule of the universe is that others can do for us what we cannot do for ourselves, and one can paddle every canoe except one's own. " -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Gratcia add a quote by Harry Truman
item.description: "Fame is a vapor, popularity is an accident, riches take wings, those who cheer today may curse tomorrow and only one thing endures - character." -- Harry Truman
